method.name: EARMGA

reference.ref: X. Yan, Ch. Zhang, and S. Zhang. Genetic algorithm-based strategy for identifying association rules without specifying actual minimum support. Expert Systems with Applications, 36(2):3066–3076 (2009).

generalDescription.type: Association Rules Mining by means of Genetic Algorithms
generalDescription.objective: EARMGA (Evolutionary Association Rules Mining with Genetic Algorithm) mines quantitative association rules of a fixed lenght in which numerical attributes are represented by a finite union of uniform intervals.
generalDescription.howWork: The genetic algorithm first initializes the current population with new chromosomes obtained by subsequent applications of the mutation operator over a given seed chromosome. At each iteration, the selection operator filters the chromosomes of the current population, producing the new one. Then, any pair of chromosomes in this new population is crossed over to reproduce two offsprings. In the next step, some of these chromosomes might also be changed due to the mutation operator and will be included into the new population. Finally, the overall process iterates until a given maximum number of loops is reached, thus generating a final population of a given size of high-quality association rules.

parameterSpec.param: Fixed Length of Association Rules: the fixed length of the mined association rules.
Population Size: the population size to handle after each generation.
Number of Generations: the maximum number of generations to accomplish.
Difference Boundary (NOT USED): the difference between the best and the worst chromosome.
Probability of Selection: the probability of selection.
Probability of Crossover: the probability of crossover.
Probability of Mutation: the probability of mutation.
Number of Partitions for Numeric Attributes: the number of uniform partitions used for splitting numerical domains.
Minimum Support: the minimum support to be fullfilled by the mined association rules.
Minimum Confidence: the minimum confidence to be fullfilled by the mined association rules.

method.example:
Problem type: Association Rules Method: EARMGA Dataset: weather Parameters: default values (
seed = 390706926)
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see XML representations of the mined association rules along with the values concerning the measures of interest, respectively, in:
"results/Asso-EARMGA.weather/result0s0.tra"
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <rules> <rule id="0"> <antecedents> <attribute name="windy" value="false"/> </antecedents> <consequents> <attribute name="outlook" value="sunnyovercastrainy"/> </consequents> </rule> ... ... ... ... <rule id="29"> <antecedents> <attribute name="play" value="yes"/> </antecedents> <consequents> <attribute name="temperature" value="hotmildcool"/> </consequents> </rule> </rules>
"results/Asso-EARMGA.weather/result0s0.tst"
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <values> <rule id="0" rule_support="0.5714285714285714" antecedent_support="0.5714285714285714" confidence="1.0"/> ... ... ... ... <rule id="29" rule_support="0.6428571428571429" antecedent_support="0.6428571428571429" confidence="1.0"/> </values>
We can also see some relevant information on-screen:
Initializing Population... done. Computing Generation #1... done. Computing Generation #2... done. ... ... ... ... Computing Generation #100... done.
Number of Association Rules generated: 30 Average Support: 0.5142857142857143 Average Confidence: 1.0 Average Antecedents Length: 1.0 Number of Covered Records (%): 100.0
Algorithm Finished
2.299 seconds
